text: Avo Uvezian (March 22, 1926 - March 24, 2017) was an Armenian-American jazz pianist and cigar manufacturer. He was born in Beirut, French Lebanon. He performed with Bob Hope and Dean Martin during his musician career. In the 1980s, he created a brad of cigars called "Avo Cigars". In 1996, more than two million Avo cigars were sold. Uvezian died in Orlando, Florida from respiratory arrest on March 24, 2017, two days after his 91st birthday. ==References== ==Other websites== * AVO Cigars Official Website * Cigar Stars - Avo Uvezian * Avo Uvezian: World Class Cigar Maestro * Strangers in the Night Category:1926 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from respiratory arrest Category:Disease-related deaths in Florida Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:American jazz musicians Category:American pianists Category:American songwriters Category:Businesspeople from Orlando, Florida Category:Writers from Orlando, Florida Category:Musicians from Orlando, Florida Category:People from Beirut
title: Avo Uvezian
